locations.addressLine: Opposite City Mall, Near Railway Station
Lal Bazaar Street, Central Business District
Hauz Khas Village, Near Deer Park
Lajpat Nagar IV, Near Central Market
Salt Lake Sector V, Near Nicco Park

issues.title: Massive Potholes on Main Street
issues.description: The entire stretch of Main Street is riddled with deep potholes, causing severe traffic jams and damage to vehicles. Urgent repair needed.

issues.title: Garbage Dump near Residential Area
issues.description: An unauthorized garbage dump has appeared near the Sector 15 housing complex, leading to foul smells and health hazards.

issues.title: Street Lights Not Working for a Week
issues.description: The streetlights on Park Avenue, Block C, have been non-functional for the past seven days, increasing security risks at night.

issues.title: Illegal Tree Cutting in Aarey Colony
issues.description: Witnessed illegal felling of several trees near Versova Beach Road. Please investigate and take action.

issues.title: Blocked Storm Drains causing Waterlogging
issues.description: Heavy rains last night caused severe waterlogging due to blocked storm drains near the station entrance.

issues.title: Broken Footpath on Sarjapur Road
issues.description: The footpath outside the tech park is completely broken, forcing pedestrians to walk on the main road.

issues.title: Irregular Waste Collection in Tollygunge
issues.description: Waste collection hasn't happened in three days, and bins are overflowing onto the street.

issues.title: Vandalism and Graffiti at Local Park
issues.description: The children's play area in the local park has been heavily vandalized with graffiti.

issues.title: Air Pollution from Construction Site
issues.description: A nearby construction site is operating without proper dust control measures, causing high air pollution.

issues.title: Low Water Pressure in Gachibowli
issues.description: Water pressure has been consistently low in the mornings and evenings for the past month.

issues.title: Damaged Road near Mylapore Temple
issues.description: A large section of the road near the temple is severely damaged and needs immediate resurfacing.

issues.title: Uncollected Commercial Waste in Magarpatta
issues.description: Commercial waste is piling up on the roadside near the main gate of Magarpatta City.

issues.title: Missing Manhole Cover near Lutyens' Delhi
issues.description: A manhole cover is missing, creating a major hazard for pedestrians and vehicles.

issues.title: Dry Lake Bed in Greater Noida West
issues.description: The local lake has completely dried up, severely impacting the ecosystem.

issues.title: Sewage Overflow on Banjara Hills Road
issues.description: Sewage water is overflowing onto the street from a damaged pipeline.

issues.title: Poor Quality Repair Work on Anna Nagar Road
issues.description: The recently repaired patch of road is already cracking and eroding.

issues.title: Open Defecation near Viman Nagar Slums
issues.description: Open defecation is still happening in the open area near the slums, posing a serious health threat.

issues.title: Excessive Noise Pollution at DLF Phase 3
issues.description: Construction work is happening late at night, causing excessive noise pollution and disturbing residents.

issues.title: Lack of Green Cover in Hauz Khas Village
issues.description: Many planted saplings have died due to lack of maintenance and watering.

issues.title: Leaking Water Main at BKC Intersection
issues.description: A major water main has been leaking heavily for over 48 hours, wasting a lot of water.

issues.title: Road Crumbling near Koramangala Park
issues.description: A significant portion of the road near the park is collapsing, making it dangerous for heavy vehicles.

issues.title: Market Waste Dumping in Gariahat Road
issues.description: Vendors are routinely dumping vegetable and fruit waste directly onto the street after market hours.

issues.title: Chain Snatching Incident Reported in Sector 18
issues.description: Reported a rise in chain snatching incidents near the crowded Atta Market area.

issues.title: Smog and Air Quality Deterioration in Jubilee Hills
issues.description: Air quality has visibly deteriorated, with thick smog covering the area every morning.

issues.title: Dirty Drinking Water Supply in T Nagar
issues.description: The tap water has been cloudy and often contains sediment. Afraid to drink or cook with it.

issues.title: Damaged Flyover Expansion Joint in Kothrud
issues.description: A large gap has appeared in a flyover expansion joint, posing a structural and safety risk.

issues.title: Industrial Effluent Dumping near Sohna Road
issues.description: An illegal pipeline is dumping chemical-smelling industrial effluent into a nearby drain.

issues.title: Unruly Auto-rickshaw Drivers in Lajpat Nagar
issues.description: Auto drivers are consistently overcharging and refusing short-distance fares.

issues.title: Park Trees Dying from Pest Infestation
issues.description: Several mature trees in the local park are visibly infected with a pest and are rapidly dying.

issues.title: Broken Water Pipe Flooding Juhu Road
issues.description: A major water pipe burst and is now flooding the entire road, making it impassable.

issues.title: Missing Guardrail on Elevated Road
issues.description: A section of the guardrail on the elevated road in Electronic City is missing after an accident.

issues.title: Medical Waste Found near Salt Lake Sector V
issues.description: Used syringes and medical waste were found illegally dumped in a public area.

issues.title: Lack of Police Patrols in Knowledge Park
issues.description: The area feels unsafe after dark due to a visible lack of police patrolling.

issues.title: Pollution of Musi River Tributary
issues.description: The tributary passing through Himayat Nagar is heavily polluted with trash and chemical runoff.

issues.title: Inconsistent Water Supply in Nungambakkam
issues.description: Water supply is erratic, often cutting off without warning for several hours a day.

issues.title: Cracked Bridge Surface on Rahatani Road
issues.description: The surface of the small bridge on Rahatani Road has large cracks that are widening.

issues.title: Stray Dog Menace in Udyog Vihar
issues.description: A large pack of stray dogs is harassing people and posing a risk to children and two-wheelers.

issues.title: Historic Building Facade Crumbling in Chandni Chowk
issues.description: The facade of a very old, historic building is visibly crumbling and pieces are falling onto the street.

issues.title: Water Taps Left Running at Public Standpost
issues.description: The public water standpost has damaged taps that constantly run, wasting water.

issues.title: Overgrown Weeds and Shrubs in Jayanagar Park
issues.description: The local park is severely overgrown, making paths unusable and becoming a snake habitat.

issues.title: Broken Street Sign near Howrah Bridge
issues.description: A major street sign has been knocked over and is lying in the middle of the pavement.

issues.title: Unsafe Electricity Box near Pari Chowk
issues.description: An open and sparking electricity distribution box is located at a busy public crossing.

issues.title: Plastic Waste Clogging Kukatpally Canals
issues.description: The water canals in the area are completely clogged with plastic bottles and bags.

issues.title: Bumpy and Uneven Road Surface in Adyar
issues.description: The road surface is extremely bumpy and uneven, causing discomfort and slow movement.

issues.title: Severe Water Scarcity in Hinjewadi Phase 3
issues.description: The area is experiencing a severe water shortage with supply only for 2 hours every other day.

issues.title: Abandoned Vehicles on Sector 56 Streets
issues.description: Multiple old, abandoned cars are left on the streets, taking up valuable parking space and becoming junk.

issues.title: Damaged Road Median near Dwarka Ramphal Chowk
issues.description: A large portion of the road median is broken, allowing dangerous U-turns and causing accidents.

issues.title: Potholes and Muddy Roads in Andheri East
issues.description: The roads in the MIDC area are full of deep potholes and become a muddy mess during rains.

issues.title: Illegal Dumping of Construction Debris in Yelahanka
issues.description: Construction companies are illegally dumping debris in the outskirts of Yelahanka New Town.

issues.title: Pollution of Tolly Nullah (Canal) near New Alipore
issues.description: The canal running through the area is visibly black and smells strongly of sewage and chemicals.

issues.title: Unlit Sections of Yamuna Expressway
issues.description: Several long stretches of the Yamuna Expressway lack working streetlights, making night driving very hazardous.

issues.title: Overflowing Public Bins in HITEC City
issues.description: The public garbage bins near the office buildings are constantly overflowing, attracting pests.

issues.title: Leaking Public Water Tank in Velachery
issues.description: The overhead water storage tank near the main road has a major leak, wasting water and damaging the street below.

issues.title: Encroachment of Footpaths by Vendors in Baner
issues.description: Footpaths are completely taken over by street vendors, forcing pedestrians onto the main road.

issues.title: Unmaintained Green Median on Golf Course Road
issues.description: The green median strip is full of dry weeds and construction debris, not maintained as a green space.

issues.title: Badly Designed Speed Breakers in Connaught Place
issues.description: The speed breakers on Radial Road 6 are too sharp and unmarked, causing vehicle damage and accidents.

issues.title: Sewage Backup in Gurugram Sector 15
issues.description: The main sewer line has backed up, causing sewage to flow into basements and onto the street.

issues.title: Broken Sidewalk and Tripping Hazard
issues.description: A large section of the sidewalk near the City Mall is uneven and cracked, posing a tripping hazard.

issues.title: Frequent Power Outages in Kaggadasapura
issues.description: The locality is experiencing 4-5 power outages daily, disrupting work and daily life.

issues.title: Potholes and Flooding on Indira Nagar Bypass
issues.description: The bypass road is heavily damaged and floods severely even during light rain.

issues.title: Stray Cattle Nuisance in Lal Bazaar Street
issues.description: Stray cattle roam freely, causing traffic disruption and leaving dung on the road.

comments.text: I agree! This is absolutely horrible, my car suspension is ruined.
I live right next to it, the smell is unbearable, especially in the afternoon. Please help!
This is a major security concern for women returning home late from work.
I saw the same last night. They were cutting the trees in the dark.
The entire street was a river. We couldn't leave our building.
Reply to Comment 1: Yes, the repairs were done poorly. The patch failed within a week.
This happens every monsoon. The BMC needs to clean the drains *before* the rains.
The local MLA was supposed to inaugurate a new footpath last month, what happened?
Reply to Comment 3: I also filed a complaint with the police but no action has been taken yet.
The stench is so strong that I can't open my windows anymore.
I've almost tripped here twice. It's a lawsuit waiting to happen.
This is shocking. Who is responsible for monitoring these sites?
Reply to Comment 12: I've also emailed the environment department with the construction company name.
We are getting water that smells like sewage. Is this linked to the low pressure?
I saw a child almost fall into this! It needs to be barricaded immediately.
It's sad to see this historic pond vanish. Where will the local birds go?
My vehicle got stuck in the flowing sewage. It's truly a nightmare.
Reply to Comment 15: I put a traffic cone over it, but someone moved it. We need a permanent fix.
The contractors clearly used substandard materials. This is corruption.
This is a disgrace for a major city. Where are the public toilets?
The noise is non-stop from 11 PM to 4 AM. I can't sleep.
Reply to Comment 21: I recorded a video last night, will upload it to this issue.
This is not just waste, this is bio-hazard! The person responsible must be penalized.
The wastage of water is incredible. This needs to be prioritized over everything else.
I drive by this section daily. It's only a matter of time before it collapses.
Reply to Comment 25: The municipality needs to check the structural integrity of the flyover.
The smell of rotting produce is terrible. It attracts rats and insects.
We need more police booths and CCTV cameras in the area.
I feel throat irritation every morning. This is severely affecting our health.
Reply to Comment 28: Yes, better street lighting is also needed.
The water is brownish-yellow. I had to buy bottled water for my family.
This crack has been growing over the last three months. It's highly worrying.
The stench from that drain is unbearable. Who can we report this to?
Reply to Comment 33: Contact the Pollution Control Board immediately!
They harass women and senior citizens. There should be a fixed rate card.
I've been watering the saplings near my gate, but the city ones are all dead.
The entire road has turned into a shallow pool. It's a traffic mess.
Someone needs to cordon off the missing guardrail before a major accident occurs.
This is terrible. The sewage is literally flowing onto the road now.
The dogs are aggressive. They chased me on my scooter last week.
That building is over 100 years old. It needs immediate restoration and support.
It's shocking to see so much water wasted when other parts of the city are dry.
I saw a snake in the overgrown shrubs yesterday! It's too dangerous to let children play.
Reply to Comment 40: We've called the local dog catcher multiple times, no response.
The road is one-way, but people are using the broken median for illegal U-turns.
It's a huge traffic bottleneck during peak hours.
Reply to Comment 43: That's a huge problem. It's a clear environmental disaster.
Someone must have hit the pole. Needs to be replaced and bolted down properly.
The sparking is terrifying. It's right where children walk to school.
The entire canal system is choked. They need a massive cleaning drive.
I hate driving on this stretch, my teeth chatter from the bumps.
Reply to Comment 50: This issue is critical. Businesses here are suffering greatly.
We need the police to start towing these abandoned vehicles to clear up parking.
The authorities need to send water tankers immediately to this area.
This is a serious safety violation. Someone could be electrocuted.
I saw the workers dump the debris at night near the lake. It was a massive truck.
The road is not passable during the rain. It looks like a quarry.
The air quality is so bad near the canal, I get a headache just walking past.
Reply to Comment 56: I have footage on my dashcam showing the dumping.
Driving on this road at night is a huge risk. Visibility is zero.
It's attracting huge rats and dogs. The whole area is getting dirty.
This has been leaking for months! The water department needs to be held accountable.
Reply to Comment 60: I saw the same leak near the post office. It's a city-wide problem.
I can't even walk to the local store because the entire sidewalk is blocked.
They promised to plant native trees here, but it's just a dumping ground now.
Reply to Comment 63: The vendors are also throwing their waste on the road now.
I saw a taxi hit its undercarriage on one of these unmarked bumps yesterday.
This is an emergency. The sewage is corrosive and damaging property.
I fell here last week and sprained my ankle. This is very dangerous.
It's impossible to work from home with constant power cuts every hour.
The new bypass is worse than the old road now. It's a joke.
Reply to Comment 69: The waterlogging is the real problem, it hides the potholes.
The traffic department needs to intervene and remove the cattle immediately.
I was mugged right under one of the broken streetlights. This is scary.
We need better enforcement of waste management rules in all markets.
Reply to Comment 72: I'm so sorry that happened! Did you file an FIR?
The council must allocate funds for heritage structure maintenance.
Reply to Comment 74: Yes, I did. The police said they'd increase patrols, but nothing changed.
This is what happens when maintenance is ignored for years.
The corporation promised a cattle pound. Where is it?
The contractors should be blacklisted for such shoddy work on the road.
I have a video of the water flowing into a nearby office building.
The entire neighborhood is suffering from low pressure. We need a permanent solution.
Reply to Comment 79: This is a common issue with local infrastructure projects.
We've had to call pest control multiple times because of the filth near the dump.
I'm worried about the spread of dengue and malaria due to the stagnant water.
The corporation needs to install proper dust netting and wet the site regularly.
This is a daily risk for two-wheeler riders. The pothole is too deep.
Reply to Comment 85: My bike tire burst after hitting it last week.
This is totally unacceptable. Where is the civic body's oversight?
We need the environmental police to investigate the source of this illegal effluent.
Reply to Comment 88: I think it's coming from a nearby textile factory.
The lack of lighting on the expressway makes it a high-risk area for accidents.
I saw the vendor's cartel threatening the municipal staff when they tried to clear the footpath.
We need more recycling options to reduce the load on public bins.
The sewage is backing up into my ground-floor apartment. This is an absolute disaster.
Reply to Comment 93: You need to call the disaster management helpline.
This road hasn't been properly surfaced in years. The city needs better infrastructure.
I saw someone throw a lit cigarette near the dry weeds. It's a fire hazard.
Reply to Comment 95: We need to file a joint petition for a full resurfacing project.
The water main leak is undermining the foundation of the nearby building.
The water looks fine in the evening, but it's very muddy in the morning.
I'm cancelling my gym membership because I'm afraid to walk home after dark.
We must save our green spaces. This illegal felling must be stopped.
Reply to Comment 101: The local activist group is planning a protest against the felling.
The corporation needs to install proper reflective paint and signage on these speed breakers.
My son's school bus had to take a major detour because of the water logging.
Reply to Comment 104: This is becoming a yearly problem that is not being solved.
The lack of water is affecting daily life and hygiene. We need better water management.
We should use a crowdsourcing app to map all the potholes and send the data to the PWD.
It's the poor drainage system, not just the roads. Both need work.
I reported the dry lake to the forest department months ago. No response.
This is a disaster waiting to happen. The crack is widening daily.
Reply to Comment 110: Someone should report this directly to the Chief Engineer of PWD.
We need dedicated police officers patrolling the park, not just occasional rounds.
The garbage collectors are demanding extra money to take the trash from our area.
Reply to Comment 113: That's blatant corruption! Report them to the vigilance department.
The entire area is prone to waterlogging because of the clogged drains.
The air pollution is visible and can be felt on the throat and lungs.
Reply to Comment 115: They need to clean the drains manually, the machines can't handle the solid waste.
The trees are dying from an unknown disease, not just lack of water. Needs expert review.
I saw the perpetrators; they were teenagers from a nearby college. Needs proper intervention.
The stench from the raw sewage is making it difficult for residents to cook or eat.
Reply to Comment 120: We need the water board to repair the pipeline immediately.
I've started carrying pepper spray because of the increase in incidents.
The government should install rainwater harvesting systems in the area.
We need to identify the exact point of the water tank leak and fix it.
The illegal U-turns are causing minor fender-benders almost daily.
Reply to Comment 125: We need police presence here for a few days to deter the U-turns.
The encroachment is forcing mothers with strollers and elderly people to walk on the main road.
The cattle pose a threat at night as they are hard to spot on the dark road.
I've created a WhatsApp group to coordinate efforts on this issue.
Reply to Comment 129: Great initiative! Send me the link.
The air pollution has been consistently in the 'severe' category for weeks.
We need stricter fines for illegal waste dumping, especially construction debris.
The canal water is toxic. Nothing can survive in it.
I'm worried about the risk of Dengue fever due to stagnant water in the potholes.
Reply to Comment 134: We need fogging operations to start immediately.
The area is turning into a slum with all the trash and illegal dumping.
This is a critical link road. It needs durable, all-weather repair.
The lack of security in this area is a big problem. We need more foot patrols.
The water has a metallic taste. We suspect heavy metal contamination.
Reply to Comment 139: You need to get the water tested by an accredited lab.
The authorities should look into undergrounding the electricity wires.
The issue of water wastage is criminal when half the city faces shortage.
We should pressure the local councilor to address this broken sidewalk.
This power outage is damaging my appliances. Who is responsible for compensation?
The tree infestation is spreading to private property as well.
Reply to Comment 145: The city needs to hire an arborist for a proper assessment.
The authorities should use high-quality road materials to prevent potholes.
The poor road design and unmarked bumps are causing a lot of accidents.
The civic issues in this city are getting out of hand. We need better governance.
The green median should be maintained with drought-resistant native plants.
